We have created a "Safe Return to School” Task Force and will meet this week to work on logistics of returning to school.

There will be a plan drafted and available as soon as possible to all.

We want to return to full capacity and normal but most likely we have ES students here much of the week, MS/HS students will have a brick and mortar schooling combined with a distance learning model. This is all to increase social distancing and be as safe as possible.

For those parents who definitely do not want their children in school, we will accommodate them with a distance learning model so they can still be a Grand Valley student and return when they are comfortable.

Have a good week and we will update you with the plan asap.

Donate $1.00/day and dress up in the theme of the day. Our goal this year is to raise $2,000. Monday- Funny Day - Dress is something funny!
Tuesday - Time Machine Day- Dress like the past, or future
Wednesday- Weekend day - Dress in comfy clothes or Pj's
Thursday - Career Day - Dress like your future job!
Friday - Gold/Yellow Day- Dress in gold or yellow to support Children's Cancer Research

Any business who would like to help reach this goal, please contact the Middle School office!

post_text: On Tuesday, the GVHS College Prep Algebra I students used motion sensors to explore the two big ideas for the state standard that requires that students can model the relationship between two quantities and interpret key components of their graphs. (F.IF.4) They had a lesson on the topic the day prior... they can "talk the talk"... today they put that knowledge to use by "walking the walk". They discussed what type of motion they would have to undergo to create the five distinct sections of a graph that was projected onto the board. They then had to "walk" their ideas towards and away from their motion sensors that would graph their walk. They finally had to see if they matched the given graph. It was a fun day filled with technology applications and high order thinking.
